result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:50 PM Defendant Vera Allela Mae Fuller in court.  Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. court questioned regarding missed appearance, court quashed warrant,  court reinstates prior bond conditions. 1:53 PM
Pre- Trial Conference October 24, 2022 at 1:50 PM

for failure to appear at the 9/21/22 return date

9:00 AM Defendant Vera Allela Mae Fuller not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. State requested a warrant. Defendant did not appear for the pretrial. Court authorized a warrant forthwith. 9:45 AM
Pretrial 9-12-22 at 3:10 pm and Return date 9-21-22 at 9:00 am
No contact with T.J. or A.D.. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Standard misdemeanor conditions.

1:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vera Allela Mae Fuller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch appeared by video for Vera Allela Mae Fuller. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond arguments. Court set $500.00 signature bond. No contact with T.J. or A.D.. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Standard misdemeanor conditions. 1:26 PM
